repositories.citation: [1] hhursev. "recipe-scrapers: Python package for scraping recipes data." GitHub, 2025. https://github.com/hhursev/recipe-scrapers
key_features: Gousto scraper migrated from HTML to JSON-LD in 2022
repositories.architecture: Abstract scraper pattern with site-specific implementations. Gousto implementation uses schema.org JSON-LD extraction after JavaScript rendering issues in 2022. Parent AbstractScraper class provides common functionality.
repositories.usage_example:
from recipe_scrapers import scrape_me
scraper = scrape_me('https://www.gousto.co.uk/cookbook/chicken-recipes/butter-chicken-with-coriander-rice')
print(scraper.to_json())
limitations: Depends on website maintaining schema.org markup
Known ingredient quantity duplication issues with Gousto (issue #1156)
No URL discovery functionality (only scrapes given URLs)
May require updates when websites change structure

repositories.citation: [2] miwels. "gousto-recipes-api: Laravel 5.3 REST API for recipes." GitHub, 2020. https://github.com/miwels/gousto-recipes-api
repositories.architecture: Laravel MVC with Repository pattern. Separates business logic from data access. Uses database migrations and seeders for data management.
repositories.usage_example:
php artisan serve
php artisan db:seed --class=RecipesTableSeeder
phpunit
limitations: Does not scrape Gousto directly (uses CSV import)

repositories.citation: [3] VFjr. "gousto-meal-planner: Gousto Recipe Finder and Recipe Card Generator." GitHub, 2020. https://github.com/VFjr/gousto-meal-planner

common_patterns: Schema.org JSON-LD is the preferred extraction method for recipe sites
Browser automation (Playwright/Selenium) required for JavaScript-rendered React applications
Migration from HTML parsing to JSON-LD extraction provides resilience against website changes
Recipe discovery (URL enumeration) is separate challenge from recipe scraping
Community-maintained scraper libraries (recipe-scrapers) reduce maintenance burden
best_practices: Use JSON-LD extraction over HTML parsing when available (more resilient to UI changes)
Implement headless browser automation for JavaScript-heavy sites
Normalize ingredient data post-extraction (handle quantity duplications)
Use sitemap.xml for URL discovery when pagination is unavailable
Monitor network requests to discover API endpoints
Handle multi-serving recipe formats with bracket notation [2 servings][4 servings]
Store high-resolution images locally rather than linking to CDN
pitfalls: Gousto's ingredient format includes serving multipliers that create duplicate quantities (e.g., '1 1 tbsp')
Recipe list pages have limited pagination - cannot easily discover all recipes
JavaScript detection mechanisms can block simple HTTP scrapers
HTML-based scrapers break when websites update structure (Gousto 2022 incident)
No obvious API endpoints exposed for recipe data
Total recipe count not displayed - requires full crawl to determine
Instructions contain newlines and serving-specific content in brackets requiring parsing
emerging_trends: Schema.org JSON-LD becoming standard for recipe SEO and data extraction
Single-page React applications increasingly common for recipe sites
Move from server-rendered HTML to client-rendered JavaScript
Recipe sites implementing anti-scraping measures (JavaScript detection)

implementation_recommendations.scenario: Quick recipe scraping for known URLs
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Battle-tested, maintained, handles Gousto JSON-LD extraction, minimal code required

implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Playwright-based custom scraper with sitemap/category crawling
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Need URL discovery (recipe-scrapers doesn't handle this), full control over extraction, can monitor network for API endpoints
Weekly menu rotation suggests API may exist, more efficient than full crawls, can detect new recipes

implementation_recommendations.scenario: Recipe data API for application integration
implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Scrape to database, expose via FastAPI/GraphQL
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Decouple scraping from application, enable efficient queries, add caching layer, normalize ingredient data

implementation_recommendations.scenario: Building similar scraper for other recipe sites
implementation_recommendations.recommended_solution: Extend recipe-scrapers library with new site implementation
implementation_recommendations.rationale: Leverage existing infrastructure, contribute to community, handle schema.org + HTML parsing

controversial_topics: Web scraping legality and terms of service compliance
Whether to fix ingredient parsing issues or preserve original website data
HTML parsing vs schema.org extraction trade-offs
Browser automation overhead vs simple HTTP requests
expert_opinions: recipe-scrapers maintainer closed ingredient duplication issue as 'NOT_PLANNED' since it reflects actual website display
Migration from HTML to JSON-LD (PR #390) was recommended for resilience against website changes
Selenium recommended for pagination handling in Gousto scraper discussion (issue #140)

json_ld_availability.implementation: Single <script type='application/ld+json'> tag per recipe page
json_ld_availability.completeness: Comprehensive - includes all standard recipe fields

data_quality_issues: Ingredient quantities include serving multipliers (x0, x2)
Duplicate quantities in some ingredients (1 1 tbsp)
Instructions contain newlines and bracket-notation for serving variations
Ingredients not structured (strings instead of objects)

observations: Only 5-6 recipe URLs discovered on /cookbook/recipes page
No API endpoints discovered in network traffic
recommended_discovery_strategy: 1. Check sitemap.xml for complete URL list
2. Enumerate all category pages and extract recipe links
3. Investigate /menu page for API endpoints (weekly recipes)

evidence: Initial HTTP request returns: 'You need to enable JavaScript to run this app'
Content loaded client-side after JavaScript execution
recommended_tools: recipe-scrapers library (may work without full browser if JSON-LD in initial HTML)

sample_recipe_object.name: Butter Chicken With Coriander Rice
sample_recipe_object.description: Butter chicken or 'murgh makhani' is a curry house favourite. To make your own, you'll simmer chicken breast in a mild tomato sauce swirled with clotted cream.
recipeInstructions: Take your chicken out of the fridge, open the packet and let it air...
Cut your chicken into large, bite-sized pieces...

total_recipe_count.notes: Website mentions ~150 weekly recipes, but no total count displayed. Requires full sitemap or category crawl to determine exact count.

next_steps.action: Test recipe-scrapers library with Gousto URLs
next_steps.command: pip install recipe-scrapers && python -c "from recipe_scrapers import scrape_me; print(scrape_me('https://www.gousto.co.uk/cookbook/chicken-recipes/butter-chicken-with-coriander-rice').to_json())"

next_steps.action: Analyze sitemap for complete recipe URL list
Enumerate category pages and extract recipe links
Implement data cleaning pipeline for ingredient normalization
focus_areas: Parse quantities and units from parentheses

sources.title: Gousto.co.uk not parsing ingredients correctly - Issue #1156
